thread.title: H.S. ROUNDUP: Whitman-Hanson golf wins by one stroke
thread.title_full: H.S. ROUNDUP: Whitman-Hanson golf wins by one stroke

author: The Enterprise
title: H.S. ROUNDUP: Whitman-Hanson golf wins by one stroke
text: Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 10:36 PM Updated at 10:41 PM Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 10:36 PM Updated at 10:41 PM The Whitman-Hanson High boys golf team survived a close shave at Ridder Farm Golf Club on Thursday, edging Plymouth North, 244-245. Senior captain Cole Manning shot a 4-over-par 38 as the medalist. Junior John Murphy finished at 5-over, and freshman Owen Manning shot a 6-over 40. The Panthers (6-6) must win three of their last six matches to qualify for the postseason tournament. BOYS GOLF Bridgewater-Raynham 227, East Bridgewater 276: Sophomore Jack Prue led all golfers with a 2-under 34 for the Trojans (6-2) in their non-league victory. Also starring for B-R: Ryan Koczela (36), Connor Anderson (37), Dylan Smith (39), Luke Myers (40) and John Stork (41). BC High 226, Brockton 257: The Eagles (4-3) saw four players shoot 1-over 37: seniors Brendan Ridge (Hanover) and Austin Coyne (Milton), plus sophomores David Driscoll and Nate Robards – both of Hingham. Oliver Ames 157, Stoughton 185: The Tigers remain perfect on the season at 10-0. Jack Green shot a 1-over 37. Steve Tasho, Mark Bissonette and Ryan McGarry all finished at 40. Silver Lake 256, Quincy 320: Dillon Brown shot 3-over 39 to earn medalist honors for the Lakers (8-3). BOYS SOCCER East Bridgewater 4, Holbrook 1: Freshman Dylan Voss scored his first varsity goal to lead the Vikings (5-3-2) to the home victory. Senior Kevin Crowley added two scores, and junior captain Mike Moore also found the back of the net. Brockton 2, Norwell 1: Rilton Carvalho had a goal and an assist for the Boxers (8-0-1). Cam Frederick added the second strike. West Bridgewater 10, Avon 0: The Wildcats (2-4-1, 1-3 Mayflower League) saw eight different players score in the win on the road. GIRLS SOCCER Abington 3, South Shore Christian Academy 3: Junior Brianna Carter (Holbrook) netted her 94th career goal for SSC (4-2-2) in the home tie. Stephanie Mykoniapis (Weymouth) added her 13th goal. Maddie Grafton had two goals and Ashli Roberts scored the third for Abington (4-3-2). Alexis LaPointe contributed with two assists. Sharon 4, Norwood 2: Four different goal-scorers got on the stat sheet for Sharon (4-4) in a non-league victory: Vicky Zambello, Ally Filipkowski, Aly Steinberg and Alex Raab. Freshman Lydia Chase won her second game, making 11 saves. West Bridgewater 5, Avon 1: Olivia Arce scored two goals for the Wildcats (4-4) in a Mayflower League game. Abby Boucher, Lydia Dunn and Addison Climo all added a score. Olivia Church and Amanda Wells had strong performances on defense. FIELD HOCKEY West Bridgewater 4, Westport 0: Ashley Congdon scored two goals to lead the Wildcats (4-4, 3-2 Mayflower). Hannah Galbato and Ashley Gillis each added a goal. Alli May, Hannah Chadwick and Julia Vanderstreet added helpers. Kayla Connors made three saves in net. Oliver Ames 1, Foxboro 1: Nicole Walker broke the scoreless tie in the second half for the Tigers (5-2-1). Dimitra Efremidas recorded the assist in the tie on the road. Page 2 of 2 - Stoughton 1, Milford 0: Courtney Campbell scored the lone goal for the Black Knights, assisted by Mia Russell. Kara Ploss was in net for the shutout. Plymouth South 3, Middleboro 1: The Panthers improved to 7-1-1 overall and 5-1-1 in the Patriot League behind two assists from Shannon Colbert. GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Whitman-Hanson 3, Norwell 0: The Panthers (6-3) won, 25-10, 25-14, 25-3, at home to move within one win of equaling their victory totals in the last two seasons. Stars for Whitman-Hanson included Sophia Raiche, Sophie O’Brien, Lily Spicer, Jessica Nihan, Allie Spyropoulos, Halle Julian and Jordyn Keith. Sacred Heart 3, Bishop Connolly 0: Senior setter Hayley Ferraro (eight aces, 10 kills and 24 assists) and middle hitter Lauren Melchionda (12 kills) led the Saints (6-2, 4-0) to a Mayflower Athletic Conference win. Canton 3, Sharon 0: The Bulldogs (7-1) won on the road as Elizabeth Hamilton had 13 kills, 11 digs and eight aces. Olivia DeVoe added 15 digs, and Nicole Poole had 26 assists with five aces. Quincy 3, Middleboro 0: The Presidents won in straight sets, 25-14, 25-8, 25-15, behind 28 kills and 24 assists. Arlington Catholic 3, Cardinal Spellman 0: Katherine Carrel had 10 kills and 10 digs for the Cardinals (7-2) in a Catholic Central League loss. Emma Sexton added 14 assists. Game scores were 25-17, 25-18, 25-20. CROSS COUNTRY Middleboro boys, girls win: The Sachems swept Randolph on the road. The boys were led by Brandon Rousseau, who took first in a time of 19:33. He was followed by Mike O’Shaugnessy (3rd), Sean Rutledge (4th), Kevin Rutledge (5th) and Jake Levesque (6th). The girls were led by senior captain Betsy Brayton, who took first in a time of 21:39. She was followed by Sarah Walgreen (2nd), Megan Braganca (4th), Caitlin Peck (5th) and Abby Wager (6th). By The Enterprise
